data.title: Casablanca
data.description: Morocco's largest city, Casablanca is a bustling metropolis with a rich history and culture. Explore the Hassan II Mosque, one of the largest mosques in the world, or stroll along the scenic Corniche beachfront promenade. Foodies can indulge in fresh seafood and traditional Moroccan tagines.

thingstodo.title: Hassan II Mosque
thingstodo.description: The Hassan II Mosque is the largest mosque in Africa and the 7th largest in the world. It has the tallest minaret in the world.

thingstodo.title: Old Medina of Casablanca
thingstodo.description: The Old Medina is a historic walled city full of narrow streets, local markets, and traditional Moroccan architecture.

thingstodo.title: Ain Diab Corniche
thingstodo.description: Ain Diab is a popular beachfront district with vibrant nightlife, cafes, and restaurants offering ocean views.

thingstodo.title: Morocco Mall
thingstodo.description: One of the largest shopping centers in Africa, Morocco Mall features a variety of international brands, an aquarium, and an ice-skating rink.

thingstodo.title: Royal Palace of Casablanca
thingstodo.description: The Royal Palace is an impressive architectural landmark located in the Habbous district, known for its beautiful gardens and intricate design.

thingstodo.title: Casablanca Twin Center
thingstodo.description: The Twin Center is a pair of skyscrapers located in the Maarif district, housing offices, shops, and a hotel, offering panoramic views of the city.

restaurants.title: Rick's Cafe
restaurants.description: A famous restaurant inspired by the classic film 'Casablanca', offering a mix of Moroccan and international cuisine.

restaurants.title: La Sqala
restaurants.description: A charming restaurant set in an old fort, serving traditional Moroccan dishes.

restaurants.title: Le Cabestan
restaurants.description: A trendy restaurant offering seafood and Mediterranean cuisine with stunning ocean views.

hotels.title: Four Seasons Hotel Casablanca
hotels.description: A luxurious hotel offering stunning ocean views, a spa, and fine dining.

hotels.title: Hyatt Regency Casablanca
hotels.description: A five-star hotel located in the city center, featuring elegant rooms and top-notch amenities.

hotels.title: Kenzi Tower Hotel
hotels.description: A modern hotel housed in one of the Twin Center towers, offering panoramic city views.

craftstores.title: Artisana Casablanca
craftstores.description: A craft store offering a wide range of traditional Moroccan handicrafts, including pottery, textiles, and jewelry.

craftstores.title: Moroccan Craft Center
craftstores.description: A popular store where you can find unique handmade items from local artisans.

craftstores.title: Le Socco de Casablanca
craftstores.description: A marketplace featuring a variety of crafts, including leather goods, carpets, and traditional clothing.

data.title: Agadir
data.description: A popular beach resort town on Morocco's southern Atlantic coast, Agadir offers stunning beaches, world-class surfing, and a relaxed atmosphere. Hike to the Kasbah ruins for panoramic views, explore the bustling Souk El Had market, or relax on the golden sands of Agadir Beach.

thingstodo.title: Agadir Beach
thingstodo.description: A long stretch of golden sands perfect for sunbathing, swimming, and water sports.

thingstodo.title: Agadir Oufella Ruins
thingstodo.description: Ruins of an old fortress offering panoramic views of Agadir and the Atlantic Ocean.

thingstodo.title: Souk El Had
thingstodo.description: One of the largest markets in Morocco, offering a wide range of goods from fresh produce to traditional crafts.

thingstodo.title: Agadir Crocodile Park
thingstodo.description: A unique park featuring various species of crocodiles and exotic plants.

thingstodo.title: Vallee des Oiseaux
thingstodo.description: A small zoo and park in the heart of Agadir, home to a variety of birds and small mammals.

thingstodo.title: Marina Agadir
thingstodo.description: A modern marina with shops, restaurants, and a lovely promenade along the water.

restaurants.title: Pure Passion Restaurant
restaurants.description: A popular restaurant offering international cuisine with beautiful views of the marina.

restaurants.title: Le Jardin d'Eau
restaurants.description: A cozy restaurant with a garden setting, serving a mix of Moroccan and French dishes.

restaurants.title: La Scala
restaurants.description: A fine dining restaurant known for its seafood and elegant atmosphere.

hotels.title: Sofitel Agadir Royal Bay Resort
hotels.description: A luxurious beachfront resort with Moroccan architecture, a spa, and several dining options.

hotels.title: Riu Palace Tikida Agadir
hotels.description: An all-inclusive resort offering a variety of amenities, including pools, restaurants, and entertainment.

hotels.title: Royal Atlas & Spa
hotels.description: A stylish hotel located near the beach, featuring a spa, multiple restaurants, and a large pool.

craftstores.title: Ensemble Artisanal
craftstores.description: A cooperative of local artisans offering traditional Moroccan crafts, including pottery, carpets, and jewelry.

craftstores.title: Tifnit Artisanal Cooperative
craftstores.description: A craft store featuring handmade items from the nearby village of Tifnit, known for its weaving and pottery.

craftstores.title: Kasbat Souss
craftstores.description: A cultural center and craft market where visitors can watch artisans at work and purchase unique handmade goods.

data.title: Marrakech
data.description: Known as the 'Red City', Marrakech is famous for its vibrant souks, stunning palaces, and beautiful gardens. Visit the bustling Jemaa el-Fnaa square, explore the historic Medina, or relax in the serene Majorelle Garden.

thingstodo.title: Jemaa el-Fnaa
thingstodo.description: The main square of Marrakech, Jemaa el-Fnaa is a vibrant marketplace filled with food stalls, entertainers, and artisans.

thingstodo.title: Koutoubia Mosque
thingstodo.description: The largest mosque in Marrakech, known for its stunning minaret that dominates the city's skyline.

thingstodo.title: Majorelle Garden
thingstodo.description: A beautiful garden designed by French painter Jacques Majorelle, featuring exotic plants and vibrant blue buildings.

thingstodo.title: Saadian Tombs
thingstodo.description: A historic royal necropolis with beautifully decorated tombs dating back to the Saadian dynasty.

thingstodo.title: Bahia Palace
thingstodo.description: A stunning 19th-century palace with lavish gardens, intricate architecture, and beautifully decorated rooms.

thingstodo.title: Marrakech Souks
thingstodo.description: A maze of vibrant markets selling everything from spices and textiles to jewelry and ceramics.

restaurants.title: Le Jardin
restaurants.description: A charming restaurant set in a lush garden, offering traditional Moroccan and international cuisine.

restaurants.title: Nomad
restaurants.description: A trendy rooftop restaurant serving modern Moroccan dishes with panoramic views of the Medina.

restaurants.title: Al Fassia
restaurants.description: A renowned restaurant run by women, offering delicious Moroccan cuisine in a traditional setting.

hotels.title: La Mamounia
hotels.description: An iconic luxury hotel with beautiful gardens, a spa, and opulent rooms.

hotels.title: Royal Mansour Marrakech
hotels.description: A lavish hotel offering private riads, fine dining, and exceptional service.

hotels.title: Mandarin Oriental, Marrakech
hotels.description: A luxurious resort featuring elegant villas, a spa, and exquisite dining options.

craftstores.title: Heritage Berbere
craftstores.description: A craft store specializing in traditional Berber rugs and textiles, handmade by local artisans.

craftstores.title: Mustapha Blaoui
craftstores.description: A hidden gem offering a wide range of Moroccan crafts, including ceramics, furniture, and jewelry.

craftstores.title: Ensemble Artisanal
craftstores.description: A government-run complex where visitors can watch artisans at work and buy authentic Moroccan crafts.

data.title: Tangier
data.description: A vibrant port city located at the crossroads of Europe and Africa, Tangier boasts a rich history and a unique blend of cultures. Explore the medina, visit the famous Kasbah, or relax on the beautiful beaches.

thingstodo.title: Medina of Tangier
thingstodo.description: A historic area filled with narrow alleys, vibrant markets, and traditional Moroccan architecture.

thingstodo.title: Kasbah Museum
thingstodo.description: A museum showcasing the history and culture of Tangier, housed in a former sultan's palace.

thingstodo.title: Caves of Hercules
thingstodo.description: A famous archaeological site featuring caves with mythical significance and stunning coastal views.

thingstodo.title: Tangier American Legation Museum
thingstodo.description: A museum dedicated to the history of the American-Moroccan relationship, located in the medina.

thingstodo.title: Cap Spartel
thingstodo.description: A scenic promontory offering panoramic views of the Atlantic Ocean and the Mediterranean Sea.

thingstodo.title: Tangier Beach
thingstodo.description: A popular beach destination perfect for swimming, sunbathing, and enjoying water sports.

restaurants.title: Restaurant La Fabrique
restaurants.description: A trendy restaurant offering French-Moroccan fusion cuisine in a stylish setting.

restaurants.title: Le Saveur du Poisson
restaurants.description: A popular seafood restaurant known for its fresh fish dishes and traditional Moroccan flavors.

restaurants.title: El Morocco Club
restaurants.description: An upscale restaurant and bar offering gourmet Moroccan cuisine and live music.

hotels.title: Hotel Farah Tanger
hotels.description: A luxurious hotel with stunning views of the bay, offering a spa, pool, and fine dining.

hotels.title: Movenpick Hotel & Casino Malabata Tanger
hotels.description: An elegant hotel featuring a casino, multiple restaurants, and a large outdoor pool.

hotels.title: La Maison Blanche
hotels.description: A charming boutique hotel offering personalized service and stylish accommodations.

craftstores.title: Galerie Tindouf
craftstores.description: A craft store showcasing traditional Moroccan art, including pottery, textiles, and jewelry.

craftstores.title: Cooperative Artisanale des Femmes
craftstores.description: A cooperative offering handmade goods by local women artisans, such as rugs, clothing, and ceramics.

craftstores.title: Art et Deco
craftstores.description: A store offering a variety of Moroccan crafts, including furniture, lamps, and decorative items.

data.title: Ouarzazate
data.description: Known as the 'Gateway to the Sahara', Ouarzazate is famous for its stunning desert landscapes and historic kasbahs. Visit the iconic Ait Ben Haddou, explore the Atlas Film Studios, or experience a desert safari.

thingstodo.title: Ait Ben Haddou
thingstodo.description: A UNESCO World Heritage site, this ancient ksar is a must-see with its stunning clay architecture and historical significance.

thingstodo.title: Atlas Film Studios
thingstodo.description: The largest film studio in the world by land area, known for its use in numerous famous movies and TV shows.

thingstodo.title: Taourirt Kasbah
thingstodo.description: A historic fortress featuring traditional Berber architecture, located in the heart of Ouarzazate.

thingstodo.title: Fint Oasis
thingstodo.description: A picturesque oasis located just outside Ouarzazate, perfect for a relaxing day trip.

thingstodo.title: Desert Safari
thingstodo.description: Experience the Sahara Desert with a guided safari, including camel rides, sandboarding, and camping under the stars.

thingstodo.title: Skoura
thingstodo.description: A beautiful palm grove offering scenic views and a chance to explore traditional Moroccan agriculture.

restaurants.title: Restaurant Douyria
restaurants.description: A cozy restaurant offering traditional Moroccan cuisine with a stunning view of the Taourirt Kasbah.

restaurants.title: Le Jardin des Aromes
restaurants.description: A charming garden restaurant serving a mix of Moroccan and Mediterranean dishes.

restaurants.title: Chez Dimitri
restaurants.description: A historic restaurant offering a fusion of Moroccan and European cuisine in a nostalgic setting.

hotels.title: Le Berbere Palace
hotels.description: A luxurious hotel with traditional Moroccan architecture, featuring a spa, pool, and gourmet dining.

hotels.title: Dar Chamaa
hotels.description: A charming riad offering comfortable accommodations, a pool, and stunning views of the surrounding mountains.

hotels.title: Riad Ouarzazate
hotels.description: A beautiful riad featuring traditional Moroccan decor, a pool, and exceptional hospitality.

craftstores.title: Cooperative Tissili
craftstores.description: A craft store specializing in handmade Berber rugs and textiles, supporting local artisans.

craftstores.title: Galerie Tiwirga
craftstores.description: A store offering a variety of traditional Moroccan crafts, including pottery, jewelry, and textiles.

craftstores.title: Maison de l'Artisan
craftstores.description: A government-run store showcasing high-quality Moroccan handicrafts from various regions.
